review: It works, and if you are really into Amazon's Prime offerings, it might be ideal. Having said that, there are other "sticks" on the market that have a remote, a greater number of apps and better user interface. I suppose you could make the case that Amazon's stick has better specs, but for me, at least, I don't notice any difference on my TVs. If I could do it all over again, I probably would have bought the other stick (the purple and black one with a dedicated remote with which Amazon competes). Nevertheless, it works and I'll keep the Fire TV Stick until it breaks. When that happens, I'll buy the other brand. If Amazon opened this device to more third-party apps, it would go a LONG way toward alleviating the shortcomings. Because I have the other stick device on another TV, I know what apps (from reputable companies) I am missing.
